text: Yue Xia Wang Fridén, born November 13, 1962 in Jiujiang, China, is a Swedish- Chinese table tennis player. Wang Fridén won the Swedish Championship for ladies in team 1998 with Norrköping's BTK. She has also received another 26 gold, one World Cup silver, two World Cup bronze, two European Championship silver and three gold in the Nordic Championship in the veteran class. Wang Fridén is famous for her difficult serving with screw variation as well as speed.Last match ball when Wang Fridén won the Swedish Championship in 1998 with Norrköping BTK. The celebration after victory in the Swedish Championship 1998. From the left: Yue Xia Wang Fridén, Du Shina, Anna Berglund, Linda Nordenberg and Annika Goldhammar together with the coach Håkan Fridén.Yue Xia Wang Fridén with Håkan Fridén in the late 1990s. Håkan Fridén was chairman and coach of Norrköping's BTK and was part of the club's great achievements before the turn of the millennium. == References == Category:Living people Category:1962 births Category:Chinese female table tennis players Category:Swedish female table tennis players Category:Chinese emigrants to Sweden Category:People from Jiujiang
title: Yue Xia Wang Fridén
